net.hudup.core.data

Class Rating

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.hudup.core.data.Rating
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable, TextParsable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    RatingMulti

    public class Rating
extends java.lang.Object
implements Cloneable, java.io.Serializable, TextParsable
    This class represents a rating that a user gives on an item. As a convention this class is called rating. In current implementation, a rating includes three important parts as follows:
    1. Rating value represented by value is a double number that a user rates on an item.
    2. The date that a user rates on an item, represented by ratedDate. Of course it contains year, month, day, hour, minute, second, etc.
    3. A list of contexts that a user rates on an item, represented by contexts. Context is additional information related to user's rating, for example, place that user makes a rating, companion indicating the persons with whom user makes a rating such as alone, friends, girlfriend/boyfriend, family, co-workers.
    As a definition, a rating is called rated (user rated an item) if its rating value is not Constants.UNUSED; otherwise such rating is called unrated. Note that rating does not specify user identification (user ID) and item identification (item ID). A set of rating that the same user gives on many item makes a so-called rating vector represented by RatingVector.
    Version:
    10.0
    Author:
    Loc Nguyen
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Field Detail

      • value

        public double value
        Rating value is a double number that a user rates on an item. This variable is public for fast accessing. If user does not rate on an item, this rating value is Constants.UNUSED.

      • contexts

        public ContextList contexts
        A list of contexts that a user rates on an item. Context is additional information related to user's rating, for example, place that user makes a rating, companion indicating the persons with whom user makes a rating such as alone, friends, girlfriend/boyfriend, family, co-workers. This variable is public for fast accessing.

      • ratedDate

        public java.util.Date ratedDate
        The date that a user rates on an item. Of course it contains year, month, day, hour, minute, second, etc. This variable is public for fast accessing.

    • Method Detail

      • isRated

        public boolean isRated()
        Testing whether user rates on an item. The methods returns true if user rated. Otherwise, it returns false.
        Returns:
        whether user rates on an item.

      • unrate

        public void unrate()
        Setting that user does not rate on an item yet, which means that the variable value is set to be Constants.UNUSED.

      • assign

        public void assign(Rating that)
        Assigning the specified rating to this rating. Note that every variable of the specified rating are assigned to every variable of this rating. There is no deep copying (cloning) of variables. Following is the code of this method:
        if (that != null) {
        this.contexts = that.contexts;
        this.ratedDate = that.ratedDate;
        this.value = that.value;
        }
        Parameters:
        that - specified rating which assigned to this rating.
